entry.title: IDs and Classes in CSS
entry.content: When to use IDs and when to use a Class in CSS while styling a Div? Idea: what if you used both and id and a class for every div. Each div would then be identified with a label. The idea is you use an id to define the layout (position on the page) and you would use classes to style the appearance. What do you think? More thought to follow…

entry.title: Dissecting Octopress; Creating a New Theme [part 01]
entry.content:
This series of posts will be written and updated in an ongoing process until we understand best how to create a new theme for Octopress. My girl friend is doing the design – I am doing the development. We both installed Octopress this week and are running it on GitHub Pages. Her’s can be found here uwenna.

For now these posts act as a brainstorm with myself… then will be broken up into better sections for publishing.

What is understood about Octopress themes so far:

There is a file called _config.yml which acts as a central reference place. This file controls data through out the site such as author name, titles, URL structure, plugin settings.

The theme is broken down into sections and put into individual .html and .scss files. These html files link and reference each other, using the { % -__- % format.

The theme files are stored in a hidden file called ‘.themes’ but are duplicated and can be accessed in the root folder.

A theme’s folder has two folders: ‘sass’ and ‘source’. ‘sass’ is the styling – ‘source’ is the structure.

How the default theme is built:

The defalut theme is called ‘classic’ and is created in the following way:
[25 scss files, 30 html files, 9 js files]

(folder) .themes > classic > sass: [3 files, 3 folders]

  • _base.scss
  • _partials.scss
  • base (folder)
  • custom (folder)
  • partials (folder)
  • screen.scss

(folder) .themes > classic > sass > base: [5 files, 0 folders]

  • _layout.scss
  • _solarized.scss
  • _theme.scss
  • _typography.scss
  • _utilites.scss

(folder) .themes > classic > sass > custom: [4 files, 0 folders]

  • _colors.scss
  • _fonts.scss
  • _layout.scss
  • _styles.scss

(folder) .themes > classic > sass > partials: [8 files, 1 folder]

  • _archive.scss
  • _blog.scss
  • _footer.scss
  • _header.scss
  • _navigation.scss
  • _sharing.scss
  • _sidebar.scss
  • _syntax.scss
  • sidebar (folder)

(folder) .themes > classic > sass > partials > sidebar: [5 files, 0 folders]

  • _base.scss
  • _delicious.scss
  • _googleplus.scss
  • _pinboard.scss
  • _twitter.scss

(folder) .themes > classic > source: [3 files, 6 folders]

  • _includes (folder)
  • _layouts (folder)
  • assets (folder)
  • atom.xml
  • blog (folder)
  • favicon.png
  • images (folder)
  • index.html
  • javascripts (folder)

(folder) .themes > classic > source > _includes: [12 files, 3 folders]

  • after_footer.html
  • archive_post.html
  • article.html
  • asides (folder)
  • custom (folder)
  • discus.html
  • facebook_like.html
  • footer.html
  • google_analytics.html
  • google_plus_one.html
  • head.html
  • header.html
  • navigation.html
  • post (folder)
  • twitter_sharing.html

(folder) .themes > classic > source > _includes > asides: [6 files, 0 folders]

  • delicious.html
  • github.html
  • googleplus.html
  • pinboard.html
  • recent_posts.html
  • twitter.html

(folder) .themes > classic > source > _includes > custom: [6 files, 1 folder]

  • after_footer.html
  • asides (folder)
  • category_feed.xml
  • footer.html
  • head.html
  • header.html
  • navigation.html

(folder) .themes > classic > source > _includes > custom: [1 file, 0 folders]

  • about.html

(folder) .themes > classic > source > blog > archives: [1 file, 0 folder]

  • index.html

(folder) .themes > classic > source > _layouts: [4 files, 0 folders]

  • category_index.html
  • default.html
  • page.html
  • post.html

(folder) .themes > classic > source > javascripts: [6 files, 1 folder]

  • ender.js
  • github.js
  • libs (folder)
  • modernizer.js
  • octopross.js
  • pinboard.js
  • twitter.js

(folder) .themes > classic > source > javascripts > libs: [3 files, 0 folders]

  • ender.js
  • jXHR.js
  • swfobject-dynamic.js

Which of these do we consider to have value?

The theme is set up in such a way where it provides tools to customize it, they can be found here –

(folder) .themes > classic > sass > custom: [4 files, 0 folders]

  • _colors.scss
  • _fonts.scss
  • _layout.scss
  • _styles.scss

(folder) .themes > classic > source > _includes > custom: [6 files, 1 folder]

  • after_footer.html
  • asides (folder)
  • category_feed.xml
  • footer.html
  • head.html
  • header.html
  • navigation.html

(folder) .themes > classic > source > _includes > custom: [1 file, 0 folders]

  • about.html

[25 scss files, 30 html files, 9 js files]
Thats alot! Beyond the custom folders which theme files are the important ones, which are just supportive and how many are little add-ons / plug-ins? …

entry.title: Machine Feelings
entry.content: Do machines have feelings? What are feelings defined as?
